intro: Scleromitrion coronarium, commonly known as the crown scale plant, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescence that resembles a crown, giving it its common name. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are small and white, clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Scleromitrion coronarium is native to southern Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
